page.title: 20Events
page.content: Events,in this area anyway,tend to be regular,and connected with fund raising.Every year in Oct/Nov there is a Three Parishes Fair (Islip,Noke,and Woodeaton) in the Islip Village Hall to raise money for the churches.Last year this raised about one thousand pounds from a great diversity of stalls stocked with local produce,gifts,etc. In Islip there is a regular annual market on the Cross Tree Green to raise money for the green itself.These are also important social gatherings.2 or 3 years ago Noke opened their village to the public.Gardens and places of local interest were open and there was a fair on the playing field.Islip followed suit in 1985 with exhibitions in the Village Hall,the School and a floral display in the church.Mr Tuffrey also put on display his collection of restored and working farm machinery.
